captions.text:
I'd jaywalk but I can't
afford getting a ticket.
I heard you lost your job.

Oh... uh, yeah.
Too bad I can't make a career out of getting

fired, right? I'd be . . . like, a CEO or
a manager? Which one's more impressive? President?
Are you going to be OK? . . .

Oh, oh my God! Ah, wait! Uh, oh, I have uh, stuff for your stuff.
. .

I got you ice for your for your crotch! I'm
shoving the crotch ice under the door!
Oh. You're awake. Wanna split a cassarole?
Why does this make me feel so sad?
AAAAAHHHH BAD DREAM! AAAHHHHH YOU WERE THERE! AAAAHHH LASAGNA'S GONE.

Nooooo . . . no no noooooo . . .
I wanna go hooooooome . . .

You have no documentable skills. You didn't
manage to finish schooling past High School.

Your work history is spotty at best. This
is a temp agency not a charity. We don't . . .

Hello? Bla bla boring phone talk
Yes. All right. Great. Goodbye.

You took too long. Now your candy's gone.
That's what happens. BKOWWWWW!

Hey, dude . . . I got you pre ----se----nnnntsss!
The pet store I used to work at is going out

I got you a bone . . . and wrapped a toy mouse
around it . . . A blanket . . . Eggplant pillow

. . . dog food . . . cat food? . . . Shampoo
. . . a leash . . . and rain boots!
Crap! I ran out of food money!
Relax, man. I'm not gonna eat YOUR food.

There better not be anything scary cryptic
written in here . . . I will scream SO. LOUD

. . .And then totally lose my marbles . . . Pretty
stationary though.

Please report to fishbowl space for temp.
work. Sign below.
Oh, lemme get you a pen . . .

Welcome, Puppycat. You look different. And
hello, unrecognized intruder. Unfortunately,

due to increased security measures, you must
now be incinerated.
She looks awed, the fire glows in her eyes.

Oh! Like a trainee-shadow? Welcome! Initiating
uniform assignment!

No. . . No, no, no, no, NO! I DON'T LIKE THIS
OUTFIT!
Let me know when you're done!
Do you want something to drink?

I knew it was you! Pretending it's just a
fairy tale-

-lying to children, making them look up to
a hero; who, in really, -
Don't tell me what to dooooo!

Hey . . . was that story you told that fish
true?
Did you forget how to talk again?

Oh, my God; I'm so glad there wasn't anything
sharp on my couch!

And thanks for not letting temp bot burn me
up. I think I'm gonna use my money to get

Deckard a casserole since he bought me a casserole
. . .
I liked your fairy tale, Puppycat.

If you want, I can help you figure out a nice
ending . . .

title: Bee and PuppyCat on Cartoon Hangover

comments.author: DW

comments.text:
This is an amazing show. It's unique and it makes my imagination go wild. 
Hope this can have soooo many more episodes, but I find it sad that people 
watch the first episode and then see the second and get mad that Bee is 
"fatter". So far I've seen so many comments saying that they should change 
her back to her old character model. Honestly Bee looks like she has more 
character with her new character model. I'm glad she has the new character 
model its so much better because she dose not have the stereotypical body 
type of every other girl or woman on TV, movies, ETC. Keep up the amazing 
work Cartoon hangover. at least you guys know how to make a show thats 
better than most on TV itself﻿

there's the logical implications.

comments.author: Juan Croce

comments.text:
wait...
at the end, when PuppyCat's reflection turned into the space outlaw for a 
second, do you think that's saying something?
The monster that Wallace turned into looked like it could be the Space 
Princess, or a variation of her. The monster/Wallace said to PuppyCat: "I 
knew it was you, pretending like it was just a fairy tale... Lying to 
children, making them look up to a hero; who in reality, is just an awful 
monster". That sounds like something they would say to the Space Outlaw, 
and as well, the monster is implying it "wasn't just a fairy tale". And 
then at the end, Bee said "I can help you figure out a nice ending..." idk 
it just seems interesting  :3﻿
